RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 63. Maiden Claiming Purse 38000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $30,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be V oid).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MODERN MIDAS bumped with a rival at the start, chased the pace between foes, dropped back late on the backstretch, went two then three wide on the turn, gained four wide into the stretch, rallied to the lead outside the furlong marker and drew away under steady urging. TWO CHUCKLES was hustled from the gate, bumped with a rival early then was taken up, steadied near the nine-sixteenths, moved from the rail to the three path on the turn, shifted five wide while gaining into upper stretch, pursued the winner into the final furlong and willingly earned the place. WOODSIDE WARRIOR was hustled to the front, showed the way with a clear advantage, went around the turn in the two path, was asked outside the quarter-pole, shortened stride under a drive in upper stretch, lost the advantage outside the furlong marker and weakened but held the show. TUNNEL VISION was hustled from the start, chased the pace on the outside then in the three path on the turn, pursued the leader under a drive into the final furlong and tired. MILAGROSO was sent from the gate then chased the pace, dropped back four wide on the turn and capitulated. ONE FOR MY BROTHER bumped with a foe at the start, chased inside through the turn and also capitulated. FORWARD CAST dropped well behind while ridden along, went four wide on the turn, dropped to the three path nearing the quarter-pole and was no factor. MAJESTIC HEART broke in at the start, bumped with a rival early, was urged along off the pace, dropped back while moving from the three path to the rail on the turn and failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Milagroso
ENTRY.OWNER: Our Sugar Bear Stable LLC and Manhattan Racing Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Forward Cast
ENTRY.OWNER: McCormack E Siobhan and Byrnes Gregory A

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 2 7F Turf CR: 92. Allowance Purse 95000. (UP TO $16,530 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners O f A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Seven Furlongs on the Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GAL IN A RUSH four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing near the quarter pole, swung three wide into upper stretch, took over command with three-sixteenths to go and edged away under a drive kept to task. DIAMOND HANDS broke out at the start and was corrected, showed the way in hand along the inside, got set down taking the inside route into upper stretch, got collared with three-sixteenths to run and ran on to secure the place honors clear of the rest. CANDLE chased three then two wide, tipped out three wide midway on the turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch and stayed on one paced to the end. VIENNA CODE chased three then two wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, weakened. POND WALKER (GB) chased along the inside pulling on the bit a bit keen early on forcing the rider to take hold briefly twice down the backstretch, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Diamond Hands
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, in hand ins, set down ins 1/4, collared, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Vienna Code
ENTRY.OWNER: Williams Andrew O and Inniss Lenox

ENTRY.NAME: Gal in a Rush
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds Larsen Chris and Titletown Racing Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed near 1/4, 3w upper, up 3/16, edged away

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Tom & Mary Lou Teal & Adena Springs

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 98. Allowance Purse 95000. (UP TO $16,530 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VICTORY WAY was forced out at the start then bumped with a foe, established a forward position early, was rated under a snug hold while inside of an opponent starting at the three-quarter pole, ranged up in the four path on the turn, made a bid near the five-sixteenths pole, took the lead into upper stretch, battled outside the runner-up under a drive into the final furlong, disposed of that foe into the final sixteenth and prevailed under strong urging. FILM STAR showed speed then dropped just off the pace, was asked to move forward near the five-eighths pole then gained to make an outside bid, vied in the three path on the turn, took the advantage inside the five-sixteenths, was headed by the winner into upper stretch, fought on with that foe to near the sixteenth-pole and was outfinished while able to get the place. WHITTINGTON PARK settled off the pace, was urged along passing the five-eighths pole, shifted from three to four wide early on the turn, gained late on that bend, pursued the top two in the stretch, swapped back to his inside lead late and finished willingly for the show. COSTA TERRA bumped with foes on both sides just after the start, settled off the pace, was urged while inside to the two path early on the turn, shifted four wide at the five-sixteenths, was driven five wide into the stretch and lacked the needed response. SHIPSATIONAL broke out then brushed with a foe, settled between horses, was urged three wide on the turn and failed to respond. RESERVE CURRENCY settled off the pace, was roused outside the five-eighths pole, traveled around the turn in the two path and also failed to respond. MR. SWAGGER bumped with a rival after the start, settled on the outside, was caught five wide early on the turn, angled to the rail near the seven-sixteenths, saved ground from that point into the stretch then moved out and had nothing left. BEZOS broke in but came out in front, showed the way down the backstretch, went around the turn in the two path, lost the lead inside the five-sixteenths and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Costa Terra
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd btwn after brk,settled,urged turn,4w5/16,5w1/4,no threat

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 4 1 1/4M Inner turf CR: 102. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 100000. INNER TURF (UP TO $17,400 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 1 22 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHULAINN broke out at the start bumping SPACE LAUNCH, chased two then three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch, rallied to issue a challenge through the final furlong taking command a sixteenth out, then dug in gamely to prevail at the end. DAUNT three wide through the first turn, chased two then three wide coming under coaxing near the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command a furlong from home, dug in and was narrowly collared a sixteenth out, fought on gamely to the finish but was ultimately staved off. SPACE LAUNCH was bumped at the start by CHULAINN, chased along the inside patiently handled until set down spinning three wide into upper stretch, ran on to secure the show honors. DRIPPING GOLD coaxed from the start, chased just off the inside, got let out spinning three wide into upper stretch, weakened in the late stages. GOOD SKATE three then two wide in pursuit, came under coaxing near the quarter pole, swung four wide into upper stretch, weakened. Q F SEVENTY FIVE coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch, dug in and was collared a furlong out, weakened in the stretch. BRAZILLIONAIRE chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch, folded, and was eased home to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Q F Seventy Five
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds and NBS Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand ins, coaxed 5/16, ins 1/4, collared 1/8, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Dripping Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds NBS Stable and Titletown Racing Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2p, let out 3w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Brazillionaire
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 5/16, ins 1/4, folded, eased home

ENTRY.NAME: Chulainn
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, 2-3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 5w uppr, up 1/16, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Space Launch
ENTRY.OWNER: Athlone Racing Oakwood Stables (Daniel J Burke) and Burke Jane
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased ins, set down 3w upper, ran on

ENTRY.NAME: Daunt
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w both turns, chased 2-3w, 4w upper, up 1/8p, collared, game

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 5 1M Turf CR: 88. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NORTHERN INVADER bobbled at the start but broke towards the front, came out some early then was bumped in the hindquarters, was rated off the pace, moved up three wide on the turn, rallied to the lead while four wide into upper stretch, kicked clear outside the furlong marker and drew away under a solid hand-ride to win ridden out. TORIGO bumped with a rival early, was rated off the pace, moved closer in the two path on the turn, swung six wide into the stretch, swapped back to his inside lead at the sixteenth-pole and earned the place while no match for the winner. RIGHT TO WIN (IRE) bumped with an opponent early, was reserved on the outside without the benefit of the cover, bumped hard multiple times with WEYHILL ROAD while keeping that foe behind horses near the half-mile pole, dropped from the four path to the three path early on the turn, was roused near the five-sixteenths, came five wide into the stretch, pursued the winner into the final furlong and lost the place while clear for the show. WEYHILL ROAD bumped with a foe early, was rated off the pace, bumped hard multiple times with a rival while trying to get to the outside near the half-mile pole then steadied, dropped from the two path to the hedge early on the turn, angled out under a drive in upper stretch and failed to threaten. GOLD FRANC (IRE) was rated on the inside, moved closer early on the turn then drafted behind the leader along the hedge, was asked when a hole opened on the inside at the quarter-pole, chased past the three-sixteenths and came up empty. FAST BOAT TO SKYE went to the front then moved clear, extended the advantage midway down the backstretch, raced inside on the turn, came out under pressure into the stretch then jostled with a foe and gave way. PAXSATIONAL stalked the pace on the outside then dropped further behind the leader, moved closer in the two path on the turn, jostled with a foe while three wide into the stretch then steadied and came up empty. VENGE drifted inward at the start, settled towards the rear, saved ground while asked on the turn and failed to threaten. MEMPHIS broke awkwardly and was off slow, spotted the front many lengths, went around the turn in the two path and never reached contention. CUBANO was a bit slow into stride, raced on the outside towards the rear under stout restraint, went three wide while roused on the turn and was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Venge
ENTRY.COMMENT: drifted in start,towards rear,inside turn,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Fast Boat to Skye
ENTRY.OWNER: Alifyfe Racing LLC and Mawaka Scott

ENTRY.NAME: Northern Invader
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds and Ingordo David

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Anderson Farms Ont. Inc. & Peter A.Berglar Racing Interest

ENTRY.NAME: Torigo
ENTRY.OWNER: Arnmore Thoroughbreds LLC and Belmar Racing and Breeding LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Weyhill Road
ENTRY.OWNER: Woodford Racing LLC Stonestreet Stables LLC Langone Ken West Point Thoroughbreds

ENTRY.NAME: Memphis
ENTRY.OWNER: WinStar Farm LLC Don Alberto Stable and Siena Farm LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Cubano
ENTRY.COMMENT: bit slw into stride,hard held outside,3w turn,no factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Dwyer S. - Grade3 BELMONT PARK RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 107. Stakes Purse 200000. FOR THREE-YEAR-OLDS. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $200 each which should accompany the nomination; $1,000 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,000 to start. For hor ses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $1,000 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% tof ourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 124 lbs. Non-winners of a Graded sweepstake at a mile or over allowed 2 lbs.; of a sweepstake allowed 4 lbs.; of two races other than maiden, claiming, starter or state-bree d allowance in 2023 allowed 6 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, June 17, 2023 with 18 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FORT BRAGG stumbled at the start, recovered to settle six paths off the inside down the backstretch just off the pace, advanced into the turn into closest aim then latched on with three furlongs to go, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and hooked up head to head with SAUDI CROWN swinging four wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive taking narrow command a furlong from home, battled on gamely trading a minor bump near the sixteenth marker before prevailing by a nostril on the wire. SAUDI CROWN broke in at the start bumping PROVE RIGHT, established the front shortly after the start and showed the way in hand four then three wide through swift splits, had the aforementioned foe advance outside and came under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung three wide into upper stretch bracing for head to head combat, dug in and was collared a furlong out, fought on gamely inside to the finish but was ultimately denied at the end while well clear of the rest. HARRODSBURG four to five wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, continued four to five wide into upper stretch, weakened while along for the show honors. JOEY FRESHWATER chased six then five wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, cornered five wide into upper stretch, tired. ALTERNATE REALITY bobbled at the break, chased four wide down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn coming under coaxing midway, angled in to take the inside route into upper stretch, made no impact. PROVE RIGHT got bumped at the start by SAUDI CROWN, who broke inwards, chased just off the inside under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung three to four wide into upper stretch, tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Prove Right
ENTRY.OWNER: Chapman, James K. and Tsujimoto, Stuart
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 2p, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Saudi Crown
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, in hand 4-3w, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, dueled, game

ENTRY.NAME: Alternate Reality
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled st, chased 4-2w, coaxed 3/8, inside 1/4, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Fort Bragg
ENTRY.OWNER: SF Racing LLC Starlight Racing Madaket Stables LLC Masterson Robert E Stonestree
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, 6w backstretch, 4w turn, 4w upper, dueled, gamely

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 95. Allowance Purse 95000. (UP TO $16,530 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BARESE pressed the pace on the outside, vied in the two path on the turn, drew even near the five-sixteenths, took a short advantage at the quarter-pole, kicked clear while asked for his best in upper stretch and drew away under strong urging. BREW PUB came away in front then wasn?t asked for speed, settled off the pace, dropped back while climbing a bit into the kickback outside the five-eighths then came under coaxing, went three then four wide on the turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and got up for the place. WINTERS LION was rated just off the pace, came under urging while three to four wide on the turn, chased the winner under a drive into the final furlong and missed the place while just able to get the show. VARATTI went to the front, set the pace under pressure to his outside, was asked along the rail on the turn, lost the lead to the winner at the quarter-pole and weakened then was caught for the trifecta. SOUTH STREET was last to commence, settled at the rear of the field, went four wide early on the turn then dropped to the two path, shifted three wide late on the bend then was driven four wide into upper stretch and failed to rally. BAD TO THE BONES was rated just off the pace, came under urging late on the backstretch, chased inside through the turn and tired. TWELTH MAN settled just off the pace, was asked between horses while two then three wide on the turn, chased into upper stretch and came up empty. UNEXPECTED (JPN) settled on the outside, dropped back in the five path on the turn and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Varatti
ENTRY.OWNER: Siena Farm LLC and WinStar Farm LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Brew Pub
ENTRY.OWNER: Rodriguez Rudy R Imperio Michael and Scuderi Vincent S

ENTRY.NAME: Twelth Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace,asked btwn foes 2-3path turn,chased,empty

ENTRY.NAME: South Street
ENTRY.COMMENT: last away,settled at rear,urged 2-4path turn,failed to rally

ENTRY.NAME: Barese
ENTRY.OWNER: Paradise Farms Corp and Staudacher David

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 8 1 1/16M Turf CR: 93. Starter Allowance Purse 65000. (UP TO $11,310 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile and One Sixteenth on the Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIMBUKTU two to three wide in pursuit from near the rear of the field, came under light coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled out six wide into upper stretch let out for the drive, rallied to issue a challenge a furlong from home and overhauled the leader just outside the sixteenth marker, then edged clear to the finish to prevail. SHINSUN just off the inside tracking from mid pack, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued just off the inside into upper stretch, ran on willingly to secure the place honors. BROKEN SPUR just off the inside in pursuit from just off the pace, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled out five wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command a furlong out, dug in under threat and was overhauled a sixteenth from home, kept on to preserve the show honors clear of the rest. KINGFISH STEVENS four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled seven wide into upper stretch, weakened in the late stages. URBAN MYTH three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled out widest of all nine wide into upper stretch and improved position passing tired rivals. MORE THAN WORK three wide in closest aim of the leader, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled three to four wide into upper stretch on near even terms for the front, then weakened in the late stages. FORWARDLY tracked the pace along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch, had no response. APOLLO RISING just off the inside just off the pace, came under coaxing five-sixteenths from home, spun three wide into upper stretch, weakened. LORD GATLING chased three then two wide under coaxing from three furlongs out, angled out five wide at the head of the stretch, weakened in the drive. BIG VENEZUELA established the front and showed the way narrowly early bobbling just outside the seven-eighths marker, settled in hand and showed the way down the backstretch and into the turn in a comfortable rhythm, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths as the pressure began to intensify, spun just off the inside into upper stretch clinging to command, dug in and was collared a furlong from home, then tired through to the finish. MO REWARDS chased three then two wide under coaxing from three-eighths, angled out six wide into upper stretch, tired. MORNING CUP chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled out three to four wide for home, tired in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Big Venezuela
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand ins, bobbled 7/8, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, caught, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Timbuktu
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, let out angled 6w upper, up near 1/16, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Apollo Rising
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off pace 2p, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Forwardly
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Shinsun
ENTRY.OWNER: Edition Farm and Conroy Linda C

ENTRY.NAME: Urban Myth
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, angled out 9w upper, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Broken Spur
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, coaxed near 1/4, 5w upper, up 1/8, collared, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: More Than Work
ENTRY.OWNER: Politano James and Northeast Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w in aim, coaxed 5/16, 3-4w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Kingfish Stevens
ENTRY.OWNER: Hammer Time Stable SOK Claiming Partnership and Lentini Maria L
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, angled 7w upper, wknd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: John A. Nerud S. - Grade2 BELMONT PARK RACE 9 7F Dirt CR: 108. Stakes Purse 250000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $250 each which should accompany the nomination; $1,250 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,250 to start . A supplemental nomination fee of $1,250 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth a nd 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weights, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a Grade One in 2022-23 allowed 2 lbs.; of a Grade Two in 2022-23 allowed 4 lbs.; of a Grade Three in 2022-23 allowed 6 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning o wner. Closed Saturday, June 17, 2023 with 12 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THREE TECHNIQUE was bumped and forced out at the start, settled towards the rear, drafted in the two path on the turn, shifted three wide while asked at the quarter-pole, moved out from behind the leader inside the three-sixteenths, rallied to the front while still on his left lead inside the furlong marker, swapped to the proper lead while moving clear at the sixteenth-pole and powered off under steady handling. SYNTHESIS broke in then brushed with a foe, settled on the far outside, was roused five wide on the turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive, chased the winner into the final sixteenth, swapped back to his inside lead late and just got up for the place. CANDY MAN ROCKET broke out and bumped with an opponent, was well placed just off the pace while off the inside, ranged up in the three path on the turn, took over while set down into upper stretch, remained on his inside lead until just before the furlong marker then swapped to the proper lead, lost the advantage to the winner just inside that marker and proved no match then lost the place in the final stride while clear for the show. SHERIFF BIANCO brushed with a rival at the start, settled off the pace, chased in the four path on the turn, remained on his inside lead in upper stretch, swapped to the proper lead near the furlong marker and tired. LITTLE VIC brushed with a foe at the start, pressed the pace on the outside under a tight hold, went to the front inside the three-quarter pole, moved clear leaving the backstretch, traveled around the turn in the two path, was asked under pressure near the quarter-pole, lost the advantage into upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and gave way. TWISTED RIDE went to the front, showed the way under pressure to his outside, lost the advantage inside the three-quarter pole, dropped back leaving the backstretch, saved ground on the turn, was asked for his best in upper stretch and came up empty. WEYBURN broke a bit slow, settled at the rear of the field, was urged three wide on the turn, came five wide into the stretch and failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Three Technique
ENTRY.OWNER: Grindley Eric Miller David E and Werner John

ENTRY.NAME: Weyburn
ENTRY.COMMENT: off bit slow,settled at rear,urged 3wide turn,5w1/4,no response

ENTRY.NAME: Twisted Ride
ENTRY.OWNER: Kasey K Racing Stable LLC Day Michael R and Final Turn Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Little Vic
ENTRY.COMMENT: brshd brk,pressed tight hold outside,lead5-1/2,clr1/2,2p,gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Synthesis
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in,brshd,settled outside,ask 5w turn,chased,up for place

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 10 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 73. Maiden Claiming Purse 45000. INNER TURF FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Clai m Will Be Void). (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MIRACLE MIKE tracked along the inside near the rear of the field, tipped to the two path into the far turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled out eight wide into upper stretch, then offered up a good finish surging home to overthrow the leader in the last jumps to the wire. FAST STUDY broke out at the start and was corrected, chased three then two wide from mid pack, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths and advanced along the rail, cut the corner into upper stretch and seized command straightened away, edged clear under a drive through to inside the eighth pole, dug in under lone threat and was overthrown in the final strides to the finish and forced to settle for the place honors. YOUR MISSION got steadied at the start when the aforementioned foe broke outwards, chased five then four wide, altered out five wide briefly as DRUID tipped out in front due to MUNNY FOR NUTHIN altering at the three-eighths, got placed to coaxing at that juncture, went seven wide into upper stretch and ran on to secure the show honors. OCTOBER BLISS four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch, brushed with AULA nearing the eighth pole and offered up a mild kick. AULA two to three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, went seven wide into upper stretch, got brushed by OCTOBER BLISS nearing the eighth pole and offered up a mild bid. DRUID chased four wide until nudged five wide by MUNNY FOR NUTHIN three furlongs from home forcing YOUR MISSION to alter out in behind, came under coaxing at that station, went six wide into upper stretch and stayed on one paced to the finish. AWESOME FORCE two to three wide in aim of the leader, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. METAMORPHOSES tracked the pace along the inside, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and offered no response. FLINTSHIRE'S ROCK coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand just off the inside, got let out spinning three wide into upper stretch, yielded the front to FAST STUDY who rallied up the inside straightened away, then weakened to the finish. MUNNY FOR NUTHIN tracked the front just off the inside from just off the pace, tipped three then four wide forcing DRUID outwards at the three-eighths and in turn forcing YOUR MISSION to alter out, swung four wide into upper stretch and weakened in the drive. PER THE HORSE RACING INTEGRITY AND WELFARE UNIT, FAST STUDY HAS BEEN DISQUALIFIED FOR A POSITIVE TEST.
